edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.clustering

Class GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.clustering.GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectiveFunction

    public class GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction
extends Object
implements ObjectiveFunction
    A function that calculates the likelihood of observing a set of points given a set of Gaussian sources generating them. This is used for clustering to determine the likelihood of having observed the ClusterObjects at their locations given the set of Clusters currently under consideration.
    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction(Vector<ClusterObject> objects)
      Constructs a new GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction that will determine the likelihood of having observed the supplied ClusterObjects at their locations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction

        public GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction(Vector<ClusterObject> objects)
        Constructs a new GaussianLikelihoodObjectiveFunction that will determine the likelihood of having observed the supplied ClusterObjects at their locations.
        Parameters:
        objects - A Vector containing the observed ClusterObjects (with locations already determined and assigned).

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector parameters)
        Evaluates the function with the specified parameters. The parameters describe a set of gaussian generators (which are the Clusters).
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface ObjectiveFunction
        Parameters:
        parameters - A RealVector containing the values of all the parameters of each Gaussian, ordered so that all the parameters of a single gaussian are together, then the next gaussian, etc.
        Returns:
        The negative log likelihood of having observed the ClusterObjects at their locations, given the parameters describing the Gaussian clusters.
